paper_abstract: This paper introduces several techniques for achieving RF and analog CMOS circuits for wireless communication systems under ultra-low-voltage Supply, Such as 0.5 V. Forward body biasing and inverter-based circuit techniques were applied in the design of a feedforward Delta-Sigma A/D modulator operating with a 0.5 V supply. Transformer utilization is also presented as an inductor area reduction technique. In addition, application of stochastic resonance to A/D conversion is discussed as a future technology.
paper_title: Low-Voltage Wireless Analog CMOS Circuits toward 0.5 V Operation
